title: Accessibility: Charts for Everyone
description: A micro-lesson that makes Accessibility: Charts for Everyone usable.

hook.text: 300 million people worldwide have color vision deficiency. Most data charts ignore them completely.

buildup.text: Red-green color schemes â€” the most common in charts â€” are invisible to the most common form of colorblindness.

discovery.text: Accessible design uses shapes, patterns, and labels alongside color so information isn't color-dependent.

twist.text: Screen readers can't interpret chart images. Text alternatives and structured data tables are essential.

climax.text: Accessible visualizations don't just help disabled users â€” they improve clarity for everyone.

punchline.text: If not everyone can read your chart, it isn't finished.
